p: The sample NCN0.10 being a SS based on NaNbO 3, retains its structure, and has orthorhombic symmetry with a monoclinic perovskite cell. The parameters of the monoclinic cell are: a = c = 3.906 (2) Å, b = 3.890 (5) Å, β = 90.62 o. The XRD pattern of the sample is shown in Fig. 2a. In Fig. 2b the dependences of the parameters a, b, β and the volume, V, of the monoclinic cell on temperature, and the change in the phase state of SS in the mode of heating and cooling are shown. At heating the following sequence of the phases change is established: 300 ≤ T ≤ 460 K – R( M 4) ( AFE P) phase, 460 < T ≤ 475 K – R( M 2) ( FE Q) phase, 475 < T ≤ 495 K – pseudocubic phase ( Psc 2), T > 495K cubic phase ( C). Abbreviation P (M) means – orthorhombic symmetry with a monoclinic subcell. The low subscript indicates the degree of multiplication of the axis b of the subcell. The areas of existence Psc 2 and R( M 2) significantly expand during cooling. The transition of Psc 2→ R( M 2) occurs at 450 K, hysteresis is 25 K. The transition of R( M 2) → R( M 4) occurs at 345 K, hysteresis is 115 K. In the heating mode, two areas of anomalous behavior of the parameters and the cell volume are distinguished: 320 < T < 360 K and 400 < T < 450 K. In the first temperature range, there is a saltatory change in the linear parameters and the cell volume; in the second one, a( T), b( T), V( T) have a wide minimum, while β( T) has a very wide maximum.
